intro: Cryptantha papillosa, commonly known as the pinkflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cryptantha papillosa is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
